Class Budget

java.lang.Object
Classes.Budget
public class Budget extends Object
The Budget class provides functionality to manage budgets in a database. Each budget is related to a user and contains information such as budget ID, category, and amount. The class allows creating budgets and editing their amount and category.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Budget(User user, Connection c)
    This constructor initializes an Analysis instance by associating it with a specific user and database connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • Budget

      public Budget(User user, Connection c)
      This constructor initializes an Analysis instance by associating it with a specific user and database connection. It initializes a Scanner instance to prepare for user's input. Additionally, it ensures that the required "budgets" table is created in the database if it doesn't already exist.
      Parameters:
      user - An object representing the currently logged-in user.
      c - The Connection object used to interact with the database.

  • Method Details

    • creatBudget

      public void creatBudget()
      Creates a new budget and adds it to the database.

      The method makes the user input a budget ID, budget amount, and budget category. Each input is validated to ensure it meets the required criteria: - Budget ID: Must not be empty and it must be unique. - Budget Amount: Must be a non-zero positive value. - Budget Category: Can't be empty and can't be a duplicate of an existing category.

      Once all inputs meets the required criteria the method inserts a new record into the "budgets" table with the provided budget details and links it to the logged-in user by their email.

    • edit_budgetTable

      public void edit_budgetTable(String id)
      Edits the budget table for the specified budget ID. The user is prompted to choose an option to update either the budget category, the budget amount, or both.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the budget entry that needs to be updated.

    • edit_category

      public void edit_category(String id)
      Updates the category of the specified budget. The method gets the current category of the budget displays it to the user and prompts for a new category. Upon receiving valid input, the category is updated in the database. The prompt keeps on showing to the user until the input is valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the budget entry whose category is to be updated.

    • edit_amount

      public void edit_amount(String id)
      Updates the amount of the specified budget. The method gets the current amount of the budget displays it to the user and prompts for a new amount. Upon receiving valid input, the amount is updated in the database. The prompt keeps on showing to the user until the input is valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the budget entry whose amount is to be updated.

    • deleteBudget

      public void deleteBudget(String id)
      Deletes a budget from the "budgets" table in the database based on the specified budget ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the budget to be deleted from the database.

    • validate_id

      public boolean validate_id(String id)
      Checks if an id is related to the logged-in user.

      THe methods gets the user's email of the specified ID and checks if it's the same as the email of the logged-in user. If the ID is valid and associated with the user, it returns true; otherwise, it returns false.

      Parameters:
      id - The unique budget ID to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if the ID exists in the database and is associated with the user's email and return false otherwise.

    • display_budget

      public void display_budget()
      Displays all budget entries associated with the current logged-in user.

      The method fetches all records from the "budgets" table in the database that is associated with the logged-in user. For each retrieved record, the budget ID, category, and amount are displayed to the user.
